greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular table where row n lists in nondecreasing order the parts of unordered partition encoded in the runlengths of binary expansion of n; nonzero terms of A227189.
comment: Row n has A005811(n) elements. Each row contains a unique (unordered) partition of some integer, and all possible partitions of finite natural numbers eventually occur. The first partition that sums to k occurs at row A227368(k) and the last at row A000225(k).
Other similar tables of unordered partitions: A036036, A036037, A080576, A080577 and A112798.
link: Antti Karttunen, The rows 1..1023 of the table, flattened
example: Row    n in   Runlengths  With one     Partial sums   The row sums
n    binary  collected   subtracted   of which give  to, i.e. is
from lsb-   from all     terms on       a partition of
to msb-end  except 1st   that row       of A227183(n)
mathematica: Table[Function[b, Accumulate@ Prepend[If[Length@ b > 1, Rest[b] - 1, {}], First@ b]]@ Map[Length, Split@ Reverse@ IntegerDigits[n, 2]], {n, 34}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 09 2017 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A227739 n) (A227189bi (A227737 n) (A227740 n))) ;; The Scheme-code for A227189bi has been given in A227189.
xref: Row sums: A227183, row products: A227184, the initial (smallest) term of each row: A136480, the last (largest) term: A227185.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 25 2013
